title: DependentUpon Convention, Resource Naming Breaking Change
body:
[Original Issue](https://github.com/aspnet/AspNetCore/issues/17269)
[VS Feedback Issue](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/826526/ihtmllocalizer-wont-work-with-vs-2019-164-preview.html?inRegister=true)

I've confirmed that the issue originated from [this PR](https://github.com/microsoft/msbuild/pull/4853)

My current target for this is 16.5 preview 2, but the holidays will likely get in the way.

------
## Solution
Okay, so it turns out this was a breaking change we wanted to take as of net core 3.0. For full context and an explanation of how resource names are chosen, see https://github.com/dotnet/docs/issues/16964. From this point on, issues that pop up that are related to this will be closed and pointed to the docs issue.

For those of you that encounter this issue, try this [solution](https://github.com/microsoft/msbuild/issues/4806#issuecomment-541018341)

It disables the dependent upon convention that we enabled by default, so you should see previous functionality restored.
